intro: Jacobaea othonnae subsp. adamsii, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Jacobaea othonnae subsp. adamsii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
